item.title: Bokul add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "I felt like time was a great sea, and I was floating on the back of a turtle, and no sails broke the horizon." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "In a perverse way, I was glad for the stitches, glad it would show, that there would be scars. What was the point in just being hurt on the inside? It should bloody well show." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Bokul add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bokul add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I will not say, do not weep, for not all tears are an evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bokul add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Agatha Christi
item.description: "I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing." -- Agatha Christi

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Never do anything yourself that others can do for you." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Hercule Poirot: I am an imbecile. I see only half of the picture. Miss Lemon: I don't even see that." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Women can accept the fact that a man is a rotter, a swindler, a drug taker, a confirmed liar, and a general swine, without batting an eyelash, and without its impairing their affection for the brute in the least. Women are wonderful realists. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "What's the world's greatest lie?... It's this: that at a certain point in our lives, we lose control of what's happening to us, and our lives become controlled by fate." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Bokul add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Bokul add a quote by Darian North
item.description: "...I knew he had something that so many of my other students were lacking... desire. Not just the desire to create because for an artist that desire arises with no conscious effort- like lust." -- Darian North
